item.title: 肯尼亚总统屈服于压力，取消 23 亿美元税收计划
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托（William Ruto）表示，他将撤回一项有争议的税收法案，向公众压力低头。此前，有人对这项计划提出了致命的抗议，要求征收 23 亿美元的新税款，导致至少 23 人死亡。【原文：Kenyan President William Ruto said he’s withdrawing a contentious tax bill, bowing to public pressure after deadly protests against the plan to raise $2.3 billion in new levies led to the deaths of at least 23 people.】

item.title: 乌克兰为何需要与债券持有人达成新协议
item.description: 距离 200 亿美元债券的两年延期偿付期结束、乌克兰必须恢复向私人债权人支付利息的时间仅剩几周。有关重组的谈判至今未能达成协议，双方在债券持有人应牺牲多少投资的问题上僵持不下。【原文：Ukraine has just a few weeks left before a two-year moratorium on $20 billion of bonds ends and it has to resume interest payments to private creditors. Talks about a restructuring have so far failed to yield a deal, with the parties at loggerheads over how much of their investment bondholders should sacrifice.】

item.title: Interactive Brokers 因纽约证券交易所故障损失 4800 万美元
item.description: Interactive Brokers Group Inc. 在本月纽约证券交易所交易中断后损失了 4800 万美元，该公司正在考虑收回这笔钱的各种方案，包括可能的法律诉讼。【原文：Interactive Brokers Group Inc. took a $48 million hit after a New York Stock Exchange trading disruption this month and is considering its options to recover the money, including possible legal action.】

item.title: 美元飙升至 2024 年新高，因美联储与主要同行立场不同
item.description: 由于美联储首次降息似乎遥遥无期，衡量美元强弱的一个指标升至 11 月以来的最高水平。【原文：A gauge of the dollar’s strength rose to its highest level since November as the first interest-rate reduction from the Federal Reserve appears distant.】

item.title: 日本神田表示高度关注日元走势
item.description: 日本货币局局长称，日本政府正在高度紧迫地关注日元走势，并称日元最近的走势是 "快速 "和 "单边 "的。【原文：Japan’s currency chief said the government is watching the yen with a high level of urgency as he described the currency’s latest moves as “rapid” and “one sided.”】

item.title: 瑞士选择连续性，SNB 行长将由施莱格尔担任
item.description: 瑞士国家银行副行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）在政府选择不任命外部人士而避免动荡之后，赢得了晋升该机构最高职位的机会。【原文：Swiss National Bank Vice President Martin Schlegel won promotion to the institution’s top job after the government opted against rocking the boat by appointing an outsider.】

item.title: 北约盟国努力就乌克兰的长期资金问题达成一致意见
item.description: 北约的几个盟国对承诺向乌克兰提供军事援助的具体多年期支出承诺持反对意见，该承诺旨在为基辅提供更多长期可预测性。【原文：Several NATO allies are balking at committing to a specific multi-year spending pledge on military aid for Ukraine that’s aimed at giving Kyiv more predictability over the long term.】

item.title: 李克强敦促加强对毕业生的就业支持
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强呼吁针对包括大学毕业生和农民工在内的关键群体出台更多就业政策，以促进中国劳动力市场的发展。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang called for more job policies targeting key groups including college graduates and migrant workers, in an effort to boost the country’s labor market.】

item.title: 克罗地亚总统米拉诺维奇表示将竞选连任
item.description: 克罗地亚总统佐兰-米拉诺维奇（Zoran Milanovic）周三表示，他计划在今年 12 月的选举中竞选第二个五年任期，他的职责包括监督北约成员国的武装部队。【原文：Croatian President Zoran Milanovic, whose duties include overseeing the NATO member’s armed forces, said Wednesday that he’s planning to run for a second five-year term in elections this December.】

item.title: CFA 一级通过率升至 46%，再次超过历史平均水平
item.description: 特许金融分析师一级考试的通过率跃升至 46%，超过了历史平均水平；不过，已经推迟考试的考生的成功率要低得多。【原文：The pass rate for the first level of the chartered financial analyst exam jumped above its historic average to 46% — though test takers who’d already delayed their exam had a much lower success rate.】

item.title: 彭博投资峰会更新
item.description: 2024 年 6 月 25 日星期二，在美国纽约举行的彭博投资大会上展示的 sigange。会议邀请资产管理、银行、财富和私人市场领域的领导者跟踪、剖析和预测未来最大的变化、风险和机遇。【原文：A sigange displays during the Bloomberg Invest event in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. The conference invites leaders in asset management, banking, wealth, and private markets to track, dissect, and predict the future's greatest changes, risks and opportunities.】

item.title: 欧盟就针对俄罗斯规避制裁的白俄罗斯制裁措施达成一致
item.description: 欧盟各国大使同意对白俄罗斯实施新的一揽子制裁，因为欧盟试图打击俄罗斯规避因入侵乌克兰而实施的惩罚的行为。【原文：European Union ambassadors agreed to a new package of sanctions on Belarus as the bloc tries to crack down on Russia’s circumvention of penalties imposed over its invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 巴西公司斥资 1.5 亿美元收购农业巨头最炙手可热的资产
item.description: 在过去十年中，拥有农田已被证明是巴西最好的投资之一。但仅限于巴西人。【原文：Owning farmland has proven one of the best investments in Brazil over the past decade. But only for Brazilians.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡与官方债权人达成最终债务重组协议
item.description: 据斯里兰卡总统的媒体部门称，斯里兰卡与双边贷款人官方债权人委员会就 58 亿美元的债务达成了最终重组协议。【原文：Sri Lanka reached a final restructuring agreement for $5.8 billion of debt with the Official Creditor Committee of bilateral lenders, according to the president’s media division.】

item.title: 胡塞武装加强攻击，红海变得更加凶险
item.description:
不断加剧的破坏活动表明，运输成本的上涨将持续下去。【原文：

Intensifying campaign of destruction suggests higher shipping costs are here to stay.

item.title: 华尔街银行在美联储压力测试前加速回购
item.description: 美国最大的银行并没有等到本周的压力测试才对其资本水平表示乐观。【原文：The biggest US banks haven’t waited for this week’s stress tests to signal optimism about their capital levels.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为南非和泰国债券将因印度纳入而受损
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Thailand, South Africa and Poland face the biggest risk of outflows as India’s sovereign bonds debut on a key global gauge, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 与美联储步调一致的债券市场即将迎来美国大选
item.description: 今年上半年的大部分时间里，国债投资者都在追随美联储的加息信号。现在，当他们在权衡下半年调整的时机时，他们还必须面对竞争激烈的总统竞选所带来的潜在风险。【原文：It took much of the first half of the year for Treasury bond investors to fall in line with a Federal Reserve signaling higher-for-longer interest rates. Now, as they weigh the timing of a second-half pivot, they must also contend with potential wild-card risks from a hotly contested presidential race.】

item.title: 巴西经济学家和交易员对下一步利率走势意见不一
item.description: 通胀前景恶化和巴西央行行长即将换人，使得经济学家和交易商对巴西下一步的利率走向产生了分歧。【原文：A worsening inflation outlook and the upcoming replacement of Brazil’s top central banker have left economists and traders split over the direction of the nation’s next interest rate move.】

item.title: 北京成为中国最后一个放宽住房规定的特大城市
item.description: 中国首都北京放宽了购房首付和抵押要求，与中国其他特大城市一道支持房地产行业。【原文：China’s capital city of Beijing eased homebuying requirements for downpayment and mortgages, joining the country’s other mega cities to support the real estate sector.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克总统表示，斯洛伐克的目标是牢牢立足于欧盟和北约
item.description: 斯洛伐克新任总统表示，斯洛伐克的目标是坚定地立足于欧盟和北约，同时他试图淡化对斯洛伐克政府对俄罗斯友好的批评。【原文：Slovakia aims to be firmly anchored in the European Union and NATO, the nation’s new president said as he sought to downplay criticism about its Russia-friendly government.】

item.title: 挪威首次提出在北极地区进行深海采矿的建议
item.description: 挪威在首次正式颁发许可证之前，正在就其计划提供用于深海采矿的北极海底区域征求意见。【原文：Norway is inviting comments on Arctic seabed areas it plans to offer for deep sea mining ahead of formally awarding permits for the first time.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。 随着科技板块继续反弹，美国股市有望跟随欧洲股市走高。电动汽车制造商 Rivian 因大众汽车（Volkswagen）的现金注入而走强，美国期权交易商则大胆押注降息。以下是今日市场动态— Morwenna Coniam.【原文：Good morning. US equities are poised to follow European stocks higher as the tech sector continues its rally. EV-maker Rivian is bolstered by a cash infusion from Volkswagen and US options traders are making a bold wager on rate cuts. Here’s what’s moving markets today — Morwenna Coniam.】

item.title: 法拉利计划订购价值 7500 美元的混合动力车和电动车电池服务
item.description: 法拉利公司（Ferrari NV）计划为其下一代混合动力和电动超级跑车提供延长保修服务，以缓解客户对电池组老化的担忧。【原文：Ferrari NV plans to offer an extended warranty service for its next generation of hybrid and electric supercars to soothe customer concerns over aging battery packs.】

item.title: 博雅银行豪赌交易型外汇业务带来稳定收入
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的货币交易收入中越来越大的份额来自于一个部门，该部门并不迎合高歌猛进的宏观对冲基金，而是迎合全球最大的企业和零售银行客户。【原文：A growing share of Bank of America Corp.’s currency trading revenue comes from a unit that isn’t catering to high-flying macro hedge funds but instead the world’s largest corporations and retail banking clients.】

item.title: 斯坦霍夫前首席财务官在首席执行官去世数月后出庭受审
item.description: 倒闭的南非零售商斯坦霍夫国际控股公司（Steinhoff International Holdings NV）前首席财务官周三出庭受审，三个月前，他的前老板在被要求向警方自首时自杀身亡。【原文：The former chief financial officer of collapsed South African retailer Steinhoff International Holdings NV appeared in court Wednesday, three months after his ex-boss died by alleged suicide when he was told to hand himself over to police.】

item.title: 帕内塔称欧洲央行必须做好应对任何政治冲击的准备
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）表示，欧洲央行决策者必须做好准备，应对在不确定性加剧的情况下可能出现的政治冲击所带来的影响。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers must be ready to handle fallout from political shocks that can occur amid heightened uncertainty, according to Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.】

item.title: 肯尼亚债券税被视为制约小型公司债市场发展的新障碍
item.description: 肯尼亚的公司债券市场已经饱受公司倒闭的困扰，当局计划对绿色债券征收预扣税，这使奄奄一息的公司债券市场面临新的挫折。【原文：Already haunted by a history of company collapses, Kenya’s moribund corporate bond market risks a fresh setback from authorities plans for a withholding tax on green bonds.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称保加利亚仍未达到加入欧元区的标准
item.description: 保加利亚在 2025 年采用欧元的计划面临新的障碍，因为欧洲中央银行称该国仍不符合条件—；主要原因是在俄罗斯乌克兰战争的影响下，过去一年的通货膨胀率远远超过了必要的门槛。【原文：Bulgaria’s plan to adopt the euro in 2025 faces new hurdles as the European Central Bank said the country still doesn’t meet the conditions — mainly because inflation has far exceeded the necessary threshold over the past year amid the fallout from Russia’s war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 虚假购买使日本书店股价下跌 10
item.description: 一家二手书店连锁店听起来可能不像是股市波动故事的背景，但 Bookoff 集团控股有限公司的股价在发现员工虚假采购后，周三暴跌了 10%。【原文：A chain of second-hand bookstores may not immediately sound like the setting for a tale of stock-market volatility, but Bookoff Group Holdings Ltd. shares tumbled 10% Wednesday after discovering fictitious purchases by employees.】
